 101 -def show_pattern_dialog(parent, name, length, dlgmode): 

 102          """ 
 103          Shows the pattern creation/modification dialog. 
 104           
 105          @param parent: Parent container 
 106          @type parent: gtk.Widget 
 107          @param name: Pattern name 
 108          @type name: string 
 109          @param length: Pattern name 
 110          @type length: int 
 111          @param dlgmode: Dialog mode (DLGMODE_NEW: create new pattern,  
 112          DLGMODE_COPY: create copy of pattern, DLGMODE_CHANGE: modify pattern) 
 113          @type dlgmode: int 
 114          @return: Tuple containing pattern name, length, and whether to switch to new pattern or not 
 115          @rtype: (string, int, int) 
 116          """ 
 117          dlg = PatternDialog(parent) 
 118          dlg.dlgmode = dlgmode 
 119          if dlgmode == DLGMODE_NEW: 
 120                  dlg.set_title("New Pattern") 
 121          elif dlgmode == DLGMODE_COPY: 
 122                  dlg.set_title("Create copy of pattern") 
 123                  dlg.lengthbox.set_sensitive(False) 
 124          elif dlgmode == DLGMODE_CHANGE: 
 125                  dlg.set_title("Pattern Properties") 
 126                  dlg.chkswitch.set_sensitive(False) 
 127          dlg.edtname.set_text(name) 
 128          dlg.chkswitch.set_active(config.get_config().get_default_int('SwitchToNewPattern', 1)) 
 129          dlg.lengthbox.child.set_text(str(length)) 
 130          dlg.edtname.select_region(0, -1) 
 131          dlg.edtname.grab_focus() 
 132          response = dlg.run() 
 133          dlg.hide_all() 
 134          result = None 
 135          if response == gtk.RESPONSE_OK: 
 136                  switch = int(dlg.chkswitch.get_active()) 
 137                  config.get_config().set_default_int('SwitchToNewPattern', switch) 
 138                  result = str(dlg.edtname.get_text()), int(dlg.lengthbox.child.get_text()), switch 
 139          dlg.destroy() 
 140          return result

 493 -def key_to_note(k): 

 494          """ 
 495          uses the active keymap to determine note and 
 496          octave from a pressed key. 
 497           
 498          @param k: Pressed key. 
 499          @type k: int 
 500          @return: a tuple consisting of octave and note or None. 
 501          @rtype: (int,int) 
 502          """ 
 503          keymap = config.get_config().get_keymap() 
 504          rows = keymap.split('|') 
 505          if k<128: 
 506                  k = chr(k).lower().upper() 
 507          else: 
 508                  k = chr(k) 
 509          for row,index in zip(rows,range(len(rows))): 
 510                  if k in row: 
 511                          note = row.index(k) 
 512                          return index+(note/12), note%12 
 513          return None

1205 -        def randomize_selection(self, widget=None, mode=None): 

1206                  """ 
1207                  Fills the current selection with random values. If the 
1208                  selection contains some values, only generate values 
1209                  which themselves already appear ("shuffle"). This is 
1210                  handy for notes, where we might want to randomise over 
1211                  (eg) a chord or a scale, rather than chromatically. 
1212                  Can be used to fill a column with a single value: 
1213                  enter it at the top, Ctrl-B, go to the bottom, Ctrl-E, 
1214                  then run this. 
1215   
1216                  If mode="constrain" (ctrl-shift-r) only generate 
1217                  values *between* min and max of those which already 
1218                  appear.  
1219   
1220                  Generated values will be spaced in the pattern 
1221                  according to row_step, so hit Ctrl-[1-9] to adjust it 
1222                  first. 
1223   
1224                  A nice use-case is to run this repeatedly, waiting for 
1225                  a nice selection to appear. Repeat ctrl-X ctrl-R to 
1226                  get unconstrained randomisation; repeat ctrl-R to keep 
1227                  "shuffling"; repeat ctrl-shift-R to keep doing 
1228                  constrained randomisation. Repeating either of the 
1229                  latter two will eventually lead to a narrowing of the 
1230                  range. 
1231                  """ 
1232                  if not self.selection: 
1233                          return 
1234                  if self.row_step == 0: 
1235                          step = 1 
1236                  else: 
1237                          step = self.row_step 
1238                  # Unlike the interpolate_selection method, we can't do 
1239                  # this without looking at the whole selection first. 
1240                  # So first, save the min and max and all vals present 
1241                  # in each column of the selection. 
1242                  minv = dict() 
1243                  maxv = dict() 
1244                  allv = dict() 
1245                  for r, g, t, i in self.selection_range(): 
1246                          if r > self.pattern.get_row_count() - 1: 
1247                                  break 
1248                          if r < 0: 
1249                                  continue 
1250                          val = self.pattern.get_value(r, g, t, i) 
1251                          p = self.plugin.get_parameter(g, i) 
1252                          if val == p.get_value_none(): 
1253                                  continue 
1254                          # We're not guaranteed that (g, t, i) index a 
1255                          # well-formed matrix (eg g=2, t=2 might exist 
1256                          # even though g=0, t=2 does not), so can't use 
1257                          # list-of-list-of-list: use dict. 
1258                          key = (g, t, i) 
1259                          if not allv.has_key(key): 
1260                                  # We don't need all the values, just 
1261                                  # the unique ones. Use set. 
1262                                  allv[key] = set([val]) 
1263                          else: 
1264                                  if not val in allv[key]: 
1265                                          allv[key].add(val) 
1266                          if p.get_type() == 0 and val == zzub.zzub_note_value_off: 
1267                                  # Note type: many values (above midi 
1268                                  # note 120, but "below" note-off) are 
1269                                  # invalid! Therefore, can't blindly 
1270                                  # randomise between min and max, when 
1271                                  # max == note-off: so don't add 
1272                                  # note-off to minv and maxv. 
1273                                  continue 
1274                          if not minv.has_key(key) or val < minv[key]: 
1275                                  minv[key] = val 
1276                          if not maxv.has_key(key) or val > maxv[key]: 
1277                                  maxv[key] = val 
1278                           
1279                   
1280                  # Go through the selection randomising each cell. 
1281                  for r, g, t, i in self.selection_range(): 
1282                          if r > self.pattern.get_row_count() - 1: 
1283                                  break 
1284                          if r < 0: 
1285                                  continue 
1286                          p = self.plugin.get_parameter(g, i) 
1287                          key = (g, t, i) 
1288                          # If row_step > 1 clear some rows 
1289                          if (r - self.selection.begin) % step != 0: 
1290                                  v = p.get_value_none() 
1291   
1292                          elif mode == "constrain": 
1293                                  if allv.has_key(key): 
1294                                          v1, v2 = minv[key], maxv[key] 
1295                                          if p.get_type() == 0: 
1296                                                  # Note type 
1297                                                  v1 = bn2mn(v1) 
1298                                                  v2 = bn2mn(v2) 
1299                                                  if zzub.zzub_note_value_off in allv[key]: 
1300                                                          # Hack to allow note-offs. 
1301                                                          ir = random.randint(v1, v2 + 1) 
1302                                                          if ir == v2 + 1: 
1303                                                                  v = zzub.zzub_note_value_off 
1304                                                          else: 
1305                                                                  v = mn2bn(ir) 
1306                                                  else: 
1307                                                          ir = random.randint(v1, v2) 
1308                                                          v = mn2bn(ir) 
1309                                                           
1310                                          else: 
1311                                                  # Any other type 
1312                                                  v = random.randint(v1, v2) 
1313                                  else: 
1314                                          v = p.get_value_none() 
1315   
1316                          else: 
1317                                  if allv.has_key(key): 
1318                                          # Subset of existing values 
1319                                          v = random.choice(list(allv[key])) 
1320                                  else: 
1321                                          # No values exist: traditional randomize 
1322                                          if (p.get_type() == 0): 
1323                                                  v = mn2bn(random.randrange(0, 120)) 
1324                                          else: 
1325                                                  v = random.randrange(p.get_value_min(),p.get_value_max()+1) 
1326                                                   
1327                          self.pattern.set_value(r, g, t, i, v) 
1328                  tmp_sel = self.selection 
1329                  self.pattern_changed() 
1330                  self.selection = tmp_sel

1470                                          continue
